title: Understanding the dynamics of ethnic identity and inequality in the UK
abstractText:
Centre on Dynamics of Ethnicity (CoDE) will transform understanding of the patterning of ethnic inequalities, investigate how inequalities relate to the ways in which ethnic identities are perceived, acted upon and experienced, and provide the knowledge and tools to enhance policy and public understanding. CoDE brings together an interdisciplinary team using quantitative and qualitative approaches to understand how ideas of, and responses to, ethnicity have changed and what impact this has on contemporary ethnic identities and inequalities.

Objectives are to:

  • profile changes in the ethnic composition of the population
  • examine the contemporary patterning of ethnic inequalities and how this has unfolded over time
  • make evidence and underlying data accessible to a full range of users
  • increase the capacity of the social scientists to engage in this area using interdisciplinary, mixed-method and comparative approaches.

The research team will bring together data from across disciplines, across topics and over time, in a usable form in order to enable a careful and methodologically innovative interrogation of this information through:

  • he interlinking of existing quantitative, qualitative and documentary data
  • the generation of new data to complement existing data
  • the historical contextualisation of data.
